content.webTitle: Trump on a collision course with justice | The minute

fields.headline: Trump on a collision course with justice
fields.bodyText: Attorney general Jeff Sessions insisted he would continue in his job “as long as that is appropriate”, after Donald Trump publicly criticized Sessions for recusing himself from the justice department’s Russia inquiry. Trump’s Times interview Sessions should have never recused himself, and if he was going to recuse himself, he should have told me before he took the job, and I would have picked somebody else. – Donald Trump Trump said it would be a “violation” for special counsel Robert Mueller to broaden his investigation of contacts between the Trump campaign and Russian entities to Trump’s past business deals and financing. Mueller reportedly has already done so... Deutsche Bank expects subpoenas I think that’s a violation. Look, this is about Russia. – Trump, on Mueller possibly looking into his finances The president is making clear that the special counsel should not move outside the scope of the investigation. – White House spokeswoman Sarah Huckabee Sanders The justice department is investigating purchases by Russians of apartments in Trump buildings and other Trump organization transactions, Bloomberg reported. Read the Bloomberg report The Senate judiciary committee is planning to hear next week in a public session from Donald Trump Jr and former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort. Jared Kushner, the president’s son-in-law, was to testify in a closed intelligence session. What will they ask Don Jr? I was seated next to the wife of Prime Minister Abe [Shinzo Abe of Japan], who I think is a terrific guy, and she’s a terrific woman, but doesn’t speak English. – Donald Trump, on his G20 dinner The euphoria of victory has worn off for Trump voters in Pennsylvania interviewed for our series The Promise. The voters blamed the media and Congress for foiling Trump, and insisted Hillary Clinton would have been worse. Read our coverage
